Data.event_text: 1 January  A fisherman from Sulawesi recovered a Chinese seaglider off the coast of South Sulawesi, raising questions on the security of Indonesian airspace and waters.

links.text: -"Nelayan Temukan Drone Diduga Milik China di Sulawesi Selatan". Viva. Retrieved 3 January 2020.-

Data.event_text: 3 January  At least 20 people were injured after a tornado struck a residential area in Cirebon Regency, West Java.

links.text: -Wamad, Sudirman (3 January 2021). "Angin Puting Beliung Terjang Selangit Cirebon, 20 Warga Alami Luka". Detik. Retrieved 3 January 2021.-

Data.event_text: 7 January  Abu Bakar Ba'asyir, the spiritual leader of the Jemaah Islamiyah terrorist organization, was released from Gunung Sindur prison.

links.text: -Yulisman, Linda (January 9, 2021). "Indonesia's top terrorist convict Abu Bakar Bashir released from prison". The Straits Times. Indonesia's top terrorist convict Abu Bakar Bashir, the spiritual leader of South-east Asia's terrorist group Jemaah Islamiah (JI), was released from prison early yesterday. [...] Ms Rika Apriyanti, the Law and Human Rights Ministry spokes-man for prisons, said that Mr Bashir's family and lawyers picked him up at the Gunung Sindur prison in Bogor, West Java.-

Data.event_text: Indonesian Ulema Council (MUI) declared Chinese Sinovac COVID-19 vaccine as halal, ending a longstanding perception conflict among anti-vaccine believers which states that the vaccine is haram.

links.text: -Nugraha, Bayu; Fajri, Reza (8 January 2021). "MUI Tetapkan Vaksin COVID-19 Sinovac Halal" (in Indonesian). Viva. Retrieved 16 January 2021.-

Data.event_text: Investigation by National Commission on Human Rights (Komnas HAM) revealed that there were indications of human rights violations on the shooting of 6 FPI members.

links.text: -Yahya, Achmad Nasrudin (8 January 2021). Rastika, Icha (ed.). "Komnas HAM: Usut Kepemilikan Senjata yang Diduga Digunakan Laskar FPI" (in Indonesian). Kompas. Retrieved 16 January 2021.-

Data.event_text: COVID-19 cases number in Indonesia reached the 800,000 mark.

links.text: -"Pecah Rekor Harian 10.617, COVID di RI Tembus 800 Ribu Kasus". CNN Indonesia. January 8, 2021. Retrieved January 9, 2021.-

Data.event_text: 1 February  Leader of Indonesia's Democratic Party, Agus Harimurti Yudhoyono, claimed that one of the senior officials with close ties to Joko Widodo had planned for a "coup d'Ã©tat" within the party, with a goal of deposing him from his position as the party's leader.

links.text: -Ansyari, Syahrul (1 February 2021). "AHY: Ada 5 Pelaku Gerakan 'Kudeta' Partai Demokrat". Viva. Retrieved 4 February 2021.-

Data.event_text: 3 February  Governor of Central Java, Ganjar Pranowo, announced a provincial level partial-lockdown for two days.

links.text: -Saputra, Imam Yuda (3 February 2021). Sushmita, Chelin Indra (ed.). "Gerakan 2 Hari Jateng di Rumah Saja: Mal, Pasar & Tempat Wisata Diminta Tutup". Solo Pos. Retrieved 7 February 2021.-

Data.event_text: 4 February  Authorities transferred 26 suspected terrorists from Makassar and Gorontalo to an exclusive penitentiary in Cikeas for tighter surveillance.

links.text: -Dirgantara, Adhyasta (4 February 2021). "26 Tersangka Teroris dari Makassar dan Gorontalo Dibawa ke Rutan Cikeas". Detik. Retrieved 7 February 2021.-

Data.event_text: Two Sumatran tigers escaped from a zoo in Singkawang after a landslide struck the enclosure. At least one zookeeper was killed. One of the tiger was later shot dead.

links.text: -"Two Sumatran tigers escape Indonesian zoo, one shot dead". The Straits Times. 6 February 2021. Retrieved 7 February 2021.-

Data.event_text: At least 3 people were killed after a massive flood and landslide swept through Semarang, Central Java.

links.text: -Perdana, Aditya Putra; Finesso, Gregorius Magnus; Utami, Kristi (6 February 2021). "Banjir Semarang Telan Korban Jiwa dan Lumpuhkan Sistem Transportasi". Kompas. Retrieved 7 February 2021.-

Data.event_text: 7 February  Indonesian Food and Drug Monitoring Agency (BPOM) approved the Sinovac COVID-19 vaccine for use in the elderly.

links.text: -Widianto, Stanley; Jefriando, Maikel (February 7, 2021). "BPOM approves China's Sinovac vaccine for the elderly". The Jakarta Post. Retrieved 9 February 2021.-

Data.event_text: Banyuwangi Airport was closed due to ashfall from Mount Raung eruption.

links.text: -Santoso, Bangun; Fauzi, Achmad (8 February 2021). "Bandara Banyuwangi Kembali Ditutup Akibat Erupsi Gunung Raung". Suara. Retrieved 16 February 2021.-

Data.event_text: As of 8 February, more than 1,000 residents had evacuated after a massive flood swept parts of Jakarta.

links.text: -Nufus, Wilda Hayatun (8 February 2021). "BPBD DKI: 150 RT Terdampak Banjir, 1.029 Warga Mengungsi". Detik. Retrieved 16 February 2021.-

Data.event_text: Hundreds of residents were evacuated due to floods in Indramayu, West Java.

links.text: -Wamad, Sudirman (8 February 2021). "Banjir Indramayu, 21 Kecamatan Terendam-Ribuan Warga Terdampak". Detik. Retrieved 16 February 2021.-

Data.event_text: 9 February  More than 35,000 people were evacuated after a massive flood swept through 11 districts in Subang Regency, West Java. A total of 5 people were killed due to the flood.

links.text: -Nugraha, Arie (9 February 2021). "35.827 Orang Mengungsi Akibat Banjir Subang". Liputan6. Retrieved 16 February 2021.-

Data.event_text: 11 February  At least 3 people were killed after a tug boat exploded in Mahakam River, Samarinda.

links.text: -"Kapal Tongkang Meledak di Samarinda, Tiga Tewas Ditemukan". CNN Indonesia. Retrieved 16 February 2021.-

Data.event_text: 1 March  Some 43 to 60 houses were destroyed and 400 others damaged by a flood in Dompu Regency, West Nusa Tenggara.

links.text: -"Update Dampak Banjir Bandang di Dompu NTB: 43 Rumah Hanyut, 400 Rusak". Detik. Retrieved 3 March 2021.-

Data.event_text: 3 March  Governor of West Java Ridwan Kamil reported the first case of the new COVID-19 UK-variant in Indonesia.

links.text: -Basarah, Rahmat Santosa; Lukihardianti, Arie (3 March 2021). "Varian Baru Corona B117 Ditemukan di Karawang". Republika. Retrieved 4 March 2021.-

Data.event_text: Members of the Democratic Party's Extraordinary Congress (KLB) in Sibolangit declared former Presidential Chief of Staff Moeldoko as the party's General Chairman.

links.text: -Garjito, Dany; Wismoyo, Aprilo Ade (5 March 2021). "5 Fakta KLB Demokrat Sibolangit, Moeldoko Diangkat Jadi Ketua Umum". Suara. Retrieved 6 March 2021.-

Data.event_text: Numerous condemnations came from Democratic Party members. Incumbent General Chairman of Democrat Party Agus Harimurti Yudhoyono described the declaration as illegitimate and unconstitutional.

links.text: -Aditya, Nicholas Ryan (5 March 2021). Prabowo, Dani (ed.). "AHY Tegaskan KLB di Sumatera Utara Tidak Sah, Ilegal dan Inkonstitusional". Kompas. Retrieved 6 March 2021.-

Data.event_text: 6 March  Ministry of Health announced tighter screenings in multiple airports and seaports after the discovery of COVID-19 variant in West Java.

links.text: -Alfons, Matius (6 March 2021). "Cegah Corona B117, Kemenkes Perketat Pintu Masuk RI di Bandara hingga Laut". Detik. Retrieved 6 March 2021.-

Data.event_text: A tourist bus carrying 66 people, including pilgrims, teachers and high school students, plunged into a ravine in Subang, West Java, killing 27 people and injuring 39.

links.text: -"Indonesia bus crashes into a ravine, killing pilgrims, students, teachers". The Sydney Morning Herald. Retrieved 11 March 2021.-

Data.event_text: Indonesian National Agency of Drug and Food Control (BPOM) approved the OxfordAstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine for emergency use in Indonesia.

links.text: -Ananda, Dea Syifa (9 March 2021). Sumartiningtyas, Holy Kartika Nurwigati (ed.). "Vaksin AstraZeneca Tiba di Indonesia, BPOM Terbitkan Izin Penggunaan Darurat". Kompas. Retrieved 20 March 2021.-

Data.event_text: 15 March  Amien Rais accused the government of planning to increase the presidential term limit from two terms to three terms.

links.text: -Ramadhan, Ardito (15 March 2021). Meiliana, Diamanty (ed.). "Amien Rais Sebut Ada Skenario Jabatan Presiden Jadi 3 Periode". Kompas. Retrieved 20 March 2021.-

Data.event_text: 17 March  BPOM halted the rollout of AstraZeneca vaccine until further research on the vaccine's blood clot issue.

links.text: -Halidi, Risna; Efendi, Dini Afrianti (17 March 2021). "Tunggu Penelitian, BPOM Resmi Tangguhkan Penggunaan Vaksin AstraZeneca". Suara. Retrieved 20 March 2021.-

Data.event_text: 18 March  Forced withdrawal of Indonesian badminton players from the 2021 All England Open sparked criticism from the Indonesian public.

links.text: -Rachman, Syaiful; Nugraha, Adie Prasetyo (19 March 2021). "Indonesia Diperlakukan Tak Adil, Menpora: Saya Minta BWF Direformasi". Suara. Retrieved 20 March 2021.-

Data.event_text: Muslim cleric Rizieq Shihab went on trial for allegedly violating COVID-19 health protocols.

links.text: -Manurung, Muhammad Yusuf (19 March 2021). Kurniawati, Endri (ed.). "Dakwaan untuk Rizieq Shihab: 33 Orang Covid-19 Akibat Kerumunan Petamburan". Tempo. Retrieved 20 March 2021.-

Data.event_text: BPOM declared AstraZeneca vaccine safe, approving the vaccine's rollout.

links.text: -Rini, Rina Ayu Panca (19 March 2021). Suhendi, Adi (ed.). "BPOM Izinkan Penggunaan Vaksin Covid-19 AstraZeneca: Manfaatnya Lebih Besar Dibading Risiko". Tribun News. Retrieved 20 March 2021.-

Data.event_text: 20 March  A Trigana Air Service Boeing 737-4Y0 skidded off the runway at Halim Perdanakusuma International Airport, East Jakarta. The plane's four occupants were uninjured.

links.text: -Librianty, Andina (20 March 2021). "Kronologi Pesawat Kargo Trigana Air Tergelincir di Bandara Halim Perdanakusuma". Liputan6. Retrieved 28 March 2021.-

Data.event_text: 22 March  A motor vessel carrying 16 people sank off the coast of Jakarta, resulting in three deaths.

links.text: -Yulianto, Agus (22 March 2021). "Kapal Motor Tenggelam di Teluk Jakarta, 3 Orang Meninggal". Republika. Retrieved 28 March 2021.-

Data.event_text: 25 March  At least 10 people were killed by a fire at a packed residential area in Matraman, East Jakarta.

links.text: -Achmad, Nirmala Maulana (25 March 2021). Patnistik, Egidius (ed.). "10 Korban Tewas Kebakaran di Matraman Anggota 3 Keluarga". Kompas. Retrieved 28 March 2021.-

Data.event_text: 26 March  The government banned Indonesians from mudik for the second time since 2020.

links.text: -Gorbiano, Marchio Irfan; Sutrisno, Budi (March 26, 2021). "Mudik' banned â again". The Jakarta Post. Retrieved 28 March 2021.-

Data.event_text: 28 March  A husband and wife perpetrated a suicide bombing during a Palm Sunday service at Sacred Heart Cathedral in Makassar, South Sulawesi. At least 20 people were injured in the attack.

links.text: -Munsir, Ibnu (28 March 2021). "Ledakan Terjadi di Depan Gereja Katedral Makassar". Detik. Retrieved 28 March 2021.-

Data.event_text: Balongan Oil Refinery in Indramayu was hit by an explosive fire. Five people were injured and more than 900 nearby residents were evacuated.

links.text: -"Indonesia fire: Massive blaze erupts at oil refinery". BBC News. 29 March 2021. Retrieved 29 March 2021.-

Data.event_text: COVID-19 cases in Indonesia pass 1.5 million.

links.text: -Setiaji, Hidayat (30 March 2021). "Kasus Tembus 1,5 Juta, Lampu Kuning Covid-19 di Indonesia?". CNBC Indonesia. Retrieved 1 May 2021.-

Data.event_text: The Ministry of Law and Human Rights dismissed the outcome of the Democratic Party's 2021 Extraordinary Congress.

links.text: -Zulham, Rizky (31 March 2021). Zulham, Rizky (ed.). "BREAKING NEWS â KLB Partai Demokrat Kubu Moeldoko Resmi Ditolak Pemerintah". Tribun News. Retrieved 1 April 2021.-

Data.event_text: A terrorist attacked the Indonesian National Police headquarters in Jakarta and was later shot dead by police. The perpetrator was the sole fatality in the incident.

links.text: -Priatmojo, Dedy (31 March 2021). "Terduga Teroris Serang Mabes Polri Sempat Todongkan Senjata ke Aparat". Viva (in Indonesian). Retrieved 1 April 2021.-

Data.event_text: 3 April  At least 17 crew members went missing after two vessels collided off the coast of Indramayu, West Java.

links.text: -Wamad, Sudirman (3 April 2021). "Tabrakan Kapal di Laut Perairan Indramayu, 17 ABK Dikabarkan Hilang". Detik. Retrieved 4 April 2021.-

Data.event_text: 4 April  Hundreds dead or missing after Cyclone Seroja struck East Nusa Tenggara.

links.text: -Ramadhan, Gilang (4 April 2021). "Longsor di Flores Timur Akibatkan 10 Orang Tewas & Ratusan Hilang". Tirto. Retrieved 4 April 2021.-

Data.event_text: 5 April  Djoko Tjandra was sentenced to 4.5 years in prison for bribing police and a state prosecutor.

links.text: -Pebrianto, Fajar; Rahma, Andita (6 April 2021). Budiman, Aditya (ed.). "6 Hal Seputar Vonis 4,5 Tahun untuk Djoko Tjandra". Tempo. Retrieved 6 April 2021.-

Data.event_text: 6 April  Long-time fugitive Samin Tan was arrested by KPK.

links.text: -Pebrianto, Fajar (6 April 2021). "6 Babak Kasus Samin Tan, Buronan yang Ditangkap KPK". Tempo. Retrieved 6 April 2021.-

Data.event_text: 8 April  The United Nations's special rapporteur on extreme poverty and human rights issued a report accusing the Indonesian government of several violations of human rights on the construction of the international MotoGP circuit in Mandalika, West Nusa Tenggara.

links.text: -Persada, Syailendra, ed. (8 April 2021). "Ini Isi Laporan Pakar PBB yang Sebut Proyek Mandalika Rampas Tanah Warga". Tempo. Retrieved 9 April 2021.-
-Adyatama, Egi (8 April 2021). "Pembangunan Sirkuit Mandalika Sisakan Kisah Sengketa Lahan dan Intimidasi". Tempo (in Indonesian). Retrieved 18 April 2021.-

Data.event_text: 10 April  At least 9 people were killed and more than a hundred were wounded after a 6.7 magnitude earthquake struck the southern coast of Malang, East Java.

links.text: -Hastuti, Rahajeng Kusumo (10 April 2021). "Gempa M 6,1 Guncang Jatim, BNPB: 6 Orang Meninggal". CNBC Indonesia (in Indonesian). Retrieved 2023-05-16.-

Data.event_text: 13 April  Tourism Minister Sandiaga Uno refutes UN allegations of human rights violations in Mandalika.

links.text: -Widodo, Wahyu Setyo (13 April 2021). "Sandiaga: RI Tidak Terima Proyek Mandalika Dibilang Melanggar HAM oleh PBB". Detik. Retrieved 13 April 2021.-

Data.event_text: 18 April  Aceh officially adopts a qanun on sharia' banking. Banks that do not implement sharia law within their branches in Aceh are forced to close.

links.text: -Afriyadi, Achmad Dwi (18 April 2021). "Sayonara! Bank-bank Ini Pamit dari Aceh". Detik. Retrieved 18 April 2021.-

Data.event_text: 20 April  Indonesian government decided to approve the research of Nusantara COVID-19 vaccine.

links.text: -Widianto, Stanley; Lamb, Kate; Da Costa, Agustinus Beo (20 April 2021). Kim, Miyoung; Sarkar, Himani (eds.). "Indonesia OKs 'private research' of COVID-19 vaccine after barring Phase II trial". Reuters. Archived from the original on 16 May 2023. Retrieved 23 April 2021.-

-Widianto, Stanley; Lamb, Kate; Da Costa, Agustinus Beo (20 April 2021). Kim, Miyoung; Sarkar, Himani (eds.). "Indonesia OKs 'private research' of COVID-19 vaccine after barring Phase II trial". Reuters. Archived from the original on 16 May 2023. Retrieved 23 April 2021.-

Data.event_text: 4 May  Ministry of Health confirmed the first cases of the South African variant and Indian 'double mutant' variant of COVID-19 in Indonesia.

links.text: -Majni, Ferdian Ananda (4 May 2021). "Kemenkes: Tiga Varian Covid Baru Sudah Masuk Indonesia". Media Indonesia. Retrieved 8 May 2021.-

Data.event_text: 5 May  Criticisms after questionable civil exam questions caused 75 KPK employees to fail, including prominent KPK investigator Novel Baswedan, who is also an acid attack survivor.

links.text: -"Kritikan dari Mana-mana tapi Tak Jelas Siapa Pembuat Soal Tes KPK". Detik. Retrieved 14 May 2021.-

Data.event_text: 6 May  17 May  In response to Indonesian government's decision to ban mudik, authorities deployed multiple personnel throughout Indonesia.

links.text: -Debora, Yantina (5 May 2021). Hartanto, Agung Dwi (ed.). "381 Titik Penyekatan Mudik Lebaran Diberlakukan Mulai 6 Mei 2021". Tirto. Retrieved 8 May 2021.-

Data.event_text: Supreme Court of Indonesia decided not to implement the Joint Ministerial Decree (SKB) on school uniforms and ordered to recall the issuance of the SKB.

links.text: -"MA Perintahkan 3 Menteri Cabut SKB Soal Seragam Sekolah". CNBC Indonesia. Retrieved 8 May 2021.-

Data.event_text: Mount Sinabung erupted, sending ash as high as 2,800 meters into the sky.

links.text: -"Indonesia's Sinabung Volcano Erupts". International Business Times. 7 May 2021. Retrieved 9 May 2021.-

Data.event_text: Regent of Nganjuk Regency Novi Rahman Hidayat was arrested by KPK for a suspected bribery case.

links.text: -"Kena OTT KPK, Bupati Nganjuk Punya Harta Rp 116 M". Detik. Retrieved 11 May 2021.-

Data.event_text: At least 8 people were killed after a landslide struck an illegal gold mine in South Solok Regency, West Sumatra.

links.text: -Al Manaf, Rival (11 May 2021). "Update Longsor Tambang Emas di Sumbar, Delapan Orang Ditemukan Meninggal". Tribun News. Retrieved 14 May 2021.-

Data.event_text: 13 May  A Firecracker explosion in Kebumen Regency kills 4 people.

links.text: -Muzakki, Khoirul (13 May 2021). Saputri, Nanda Lusiana (ed.). "UPDATE Korban Tewas Akibat Ledakan Petasan di Kebumen, Bertambah Jadi 4 Orang". Tribun News. Retrieved 14 May 2021.-

Data.event_text: 15 May  At least 6 people were killed, 3 were missing after a tourist boat capsized in Kedungombo reservoir, Boyolali Regency.

links.text: -Ajiyanto, Ragil (16 May 2021). "Selfie di Perahu Wisata Waduk Kedungombo yang Berujung Maut". Detik. Retrieved 16 May 2021.-

Data.event_text: 17 May  Indonesian government temporarily halted the distribution of AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine after reports of serious side effects.

links.text: -"Pemerintah Setop Sementara AstraZeneca Batch CTMAV547". VOA Indonesia. 16 May 2021. Retrieved 19 May 2021.-

Data.event_text: 21 May  More than 1,300 houses were damaged after a strong magnitude 5.9 Richter scale earthquake struck Blitar at a shallow depth of 10Â km.

links.text: -Midaada, Avirista (24 May 2021). "Kerusakan Gempa Bumi di Malang Kian Meluas, 404 Rumah Warga Rusak". Okezone. Retrieved 25 May 2021.-
-"Update, Gempa Blitar Akibatkan 1.374 Rumah dan 62 Fasum Rusak". 21 January 2022. 27 May 2021.-

Data.event_text: 22 May  A passenger boat carrying 26 people sank off the coast of Jambi, killing at least 8.

links.text: -Putri, Eka Alisa (26 May 2021). "Seluruh Korban Kapal Tenggelam KM Wicly Jaya Sakti di Jambi Telah Ditemukan, Berikut Kronologinya". Pikiran Rakyat. Retrieved 12 June 2021.-

Data.event_text: 26 May  At least 8 people were killed after a pickup truck struck a tree in Malang.

links.text: -Aminudin, Muhammad (26 May 2021). "Pikap Muat Rombongan Arisan Tewaskan 7 Orang di Malang Berisi 12 Penumpang". Detik. Retrieved 28 May 2021.-

Data.event_text: 28 May  A Robinson R44 helicopter crashed onto a lake in Depok, West Java.

links.text: -Berutu, Sachril Agustin (28 May 2021). "Tim dari KNKT Cek Lokasi Heli Jatuh Pakai Perahu Naga". Detik. Retrieved 28 May 2021.-

Data.event_text: 3 June  Government confirms that it will not embark Hajj pilgrims for this year's Hajj due to the ongoing COVID-19 outbreak.

links.text: -Umah, Anisatul (5 June 2021). "RI Batal Berangkatkan Jemaah Haji 2021 & Penjelasan Saudi". CNBC Indonesia. Retrieved 11 June 2021.-

Data.event_text: 11 June  Indonesian Mining Advocacy Network (Jatam) asked authorities to investigate the death of Vice Regent of Sangihe Islands Regency Helmud Hontong after dubbing his death as suspicious.

links.text: -Rosana, Francisca Christy (11 June 2021). Wibowo, Eko Ari (ed.). "Jatam Desak Aparat Investigasi Penyebab Kematian Wakil Bupati Kepulauan Sangihe". Tempo. Retrieved 18 June 2021.-

Data.event_text: 14 June  North Sulawesi forensic analyst reported that preliminary findings from the autopsy of Helmud Hontong didn't indicate signs of intentional poisoning.

links.text: -Maharani, Tsarina (14 June 2021). Galih, Bayu (ed.). "Otopsi Jenazah Wabup Sangihe, Polisi: Tidak Ada Temuan Racun". Kompas. Retrieved 18 June 2021.-

Data.event_text: 16 June  A 0.5 meter tall tsunami struck Central Maluku Regency after a magnitude 6.1 earthquake caused an undersea landslide. No injuries were reported.

links.text: -Pardede, Doan (18 June 2021). Desmawangga, Christoper (ed.). "BMKG Ungkap Keanehan Tsunami yang Melanda Maluku Usai Diguncang Gempa M 6,1: Seharusnya Tidak Ada". Tribun News. Retrieved 18 June 2021.-

Data.event_text: Bank Indonesia bans cryptocurrency as legal payment.

links.text: -Kencana, Maulandy Rizky Bayu (17 June 2021). "Indonesia Tidak Akan Pernah Legalkan Kripto Jadi Mata Uang Sah hingga Puluhan Tahun ke Depan". Liputan6. Retrieved 18 June 2021.-

Data.event_text: WHO warned the government of Indonesia of a possible COVID-19 surge caused by Delta variant of the virus.

links.text: -"WHO warns of fresh Indonesia COVID-19 surge fed by virus variants". Channel News Asia. Retrieved 18 June 2021.-

Data.event_text: COVID-19 cases reached 2 million, highest in Southeast Asia.

links.text: -Azanella, Luthfia Ayu (22 June 2021). Kurniawan, Rendika Ferri (ed.). "Covid-19 Tembus 2 Juta, Ini Langkah Pemerintah dan Pentingnya Peran Masyarakat". Kompas. Retrieved 23 June 2021.-

Data.event_text: Government announced harsher restrictions in several regions after surge in COVID-19 cases across Indonesia.

links.text: -Haryati, Sri, ed. (21 June 2021). "Malls, markets to operate until 8 p.m. local time: Minister". Antara. Retrieved 23 June 2021.-

Data.event_text: Clashes in the street after controversial hardline cleric Rizieq Shihab was sentenced to 4 years in prison for "lying on his COVID-19 test result".

links.text: -Ruqoyah, Siti (24 June 2021). "Ricuh, Pendukung Habib Rizieq Lempari Polisi Pakai Batu". Viva. Retrieved 27 June 2021.-

Data.event_text: Unidentified gunmen shot dead five civilians in Yahukimo, Papua.

links.text: -Assegaf, Fardah (24 June 2021). "Unidentified gunmen fatally shoot 5 people in Papua's Yahukimo". Antara News. Retrieved 26 June 2021.-

Data.event_text: Indonesia recorded its highest daily increase of COVID-19 to date, with 20,574 positive cases.

links.text: -Bramasta, Dandy Bayu (25 June 2021). Wedhaswary, Inggried Dwi (ed.). "20.574 Kasus Covid-19 dalam Sehari, Ini Provinsi dengan Penambahan Tertinggi". Kompas. Retrieved 26 June 2021.-

Data.event_text: 28 June  Regent of Mamberamo Raya Dorinus Dasinapa was arrested for alleged embezzlement of COVID-19 aid and funds.

links.text: -"Bupati Mamberamo Raya Jadi Tersangka Korupsi Dana Covid". CNN Indonesia. Retrieved 30 June 2021.-

Data.event_text: 1 July  President Joko Widodo announced two weeks island-wide lockdown in Java and Bali after record surge of COVID-19 cases throughout the country.

links.text: -Priyasmoro, Muhammad Radityo (1 July 2021). "PPKM Darurat Jawa â Bali: Rumah Ibadah dan Tempat Wisata Ditutup Sementara". Liputan6. Retrieved 2 July 2021.-

Data.event_text: LaporCovid19 reports that Indonesian healthcare facility has collapsed as surge in COVID-19 cases causes high BOR across multiple healthcare facilities.

links.text: -Ismail, Taufik (4 July 2021). Haryadi, Malvyandie (ed.). "Faskes Kolaps, Sebanyak 265 Pasien Isoman Covid-19 Meninggal Dunia". TribunNews (in Indonesian). Retrieved 2021-07-08.-

Data.event_text: Spokeswoman of the Indonesian Ministry of Health denied reports that multiple healthcare facilities across Indonesia had collapsed due to surging COVID-19 patients.

links.text: -Sidik, Farih Maulana (4 July 2021). "Kemenkes Bantah LaporCovid-19: Tak Benar Faskes RI Kolaps Hadapi Pandemi". Detik. Retrieved 5 July 2021.-

Data.event_text: Oxygen shortages were reported across 5 provinces in Indonesia.

links.text: -Salbiah, Nurul Adriyana (4 July 2021). "RS Rujukan Covid-19 di 5 Provinsi Alami Kelangkaan Oksigen". JawaPost. Retrieved 5 July 2021.-

Data.event_text: Official at Yogyakarta's Dr. Sardjito Hospital reported the death of 33 patients, including non-COVID-19 patients, due to oxygen shortage.

links.text: -Umaiyah, Siti (4 July 2021). "33 Pasien di RSUP Sardjito Yogya Meninggal Usai Oksigen Sentral Habis". IDN Times. Archived from the original on 9 July 2021. Retrieved 5 July 2021.-
-Umaiyah, Siti (4 July 2021). "33 Pasien di RSUP Sardjito Yogya Meninggal Usai Oksigen Sentral Habis". IDN Times. Archived from the original on 9 July 2021. Retrieved 5 July 2021.-

Data.event_text: Government to bar unvaccinated arrivals after COVID-19 cases skyrocketed across Indonesia.

links.text: -"Indonesia imposes stricter requirements on international arrivals; 27, 233 Covid-19 cases on Sunday (July 4)". The Star. Retrieved 5 July 2021.-

Data.event_text: 8 July  Number of deaths due to COVID-19 passed 1,000 cases, first time since the pandemic began in the country.

links.text: -Yahya, Achmad Nasrudin (8 July 2021). Galih, Bayu (ed.). "Angka Kematian Covid-19 Lewati 1.000 Pasien Sehari dan Upaya Penuhi Ketersediaan Oksigen..." Kompas. Retrieved 16 July 2021.-

Data.event_text: 12 July  At least 8 were killed after a bus crash in Pemalang, Central Java.

links.text: -Darmawan, Reza Kurnia (11 July 2021). "Kecelakaan Maut di Tol Pejagan-Pemalang, 8 Tewas, Bus Sempat Bentur Truk Sebelum Terguling". Kompas. Retrieved 14 July 2021.-

Data.event_text: 13 July  Government postponed plan to sell private COVID-19 vaccine after harsh criticisms from parliamentarians and public.

links.text: -"Indonesia delays private Covid-19 jab sales". Phnom Penh Post. Retrieved 14 July 2021.-

Data.event_text: 14 July  Indonesia becomes the epicentre of COVID-19 outbreak in Asia as the country's newest daily infections overtakes India.

links.text: -"Indonesia New COVID 'Epicentre Of Asia'". The Asean Post. 29 December 2016. Retrieved 16 July 2021.-

Data.event_text: 15 July  Search and rescue personnel were deployed  after 14 vessels carrying fishermen capsized during a storm off the coast of Pontianak, West Kalimantan. At least 9 were killed and more than 40 people were missing.

links.text: -"14 Kapal Nelayan Tenggelam: 9 Orang Tewas dan 47 Hilang". Kompas. Retrieved 16 July 2021.-

Data.event_text: 1 August  Committee of UNESCO World Heritage Site urged the Indonesian government to stop tourism projects in Komodo National Park after perceived threats to the surrounding ecosystem.

links.text: -"UNESCO calls on Indonesian gov't to halt tourism projects in Komodo National Park". Coconuts. 3 August 2021. Retrieved 8 August 2021.-

Data.event_text: 2 August  Indonesia wins its first gold medal in badminton Women's Doubles during the 2020 Tokyo Olympics.

links.text: -"Olympics: Indonesia breaks Chinese stranglehold in badminton women's doubles". Channel News Asia. Retrieved 8 August 2021.-

Data.event_text: 3 August  PPKM to be extended until 9 August.

links.text: -Saptoyo, Rosy Dewi Arianti (3 August 2021). Hardiyanto, Sari (ed.). "PPKM Level 4 Diperpanjang hingga 9 Agustus, Simak Aturan Lengkapnya". Kompas. Retrieved 8 August 2021.-

Data.event_text: 9 August  Coordinating Minister of Maritime Affairs and Investment Luhut Binsar Pandjaitan announced that PPKM in the island of Java and Bali would be extended until 16 August.

links.text: -Nurita, Dewi (9 August 2021). Wibowo, Eko Ari (ed.). "PPKM Level 4 Diperpanjang hingga 16 Agustus, Ini Syarat Bisa Masuk Mal". Tempo. Retrieved 10 August 2021.-

Data.event_text: Government of Nigeria threatens to sever ties following a viral video of a possible assault on one of its diplomat in Jakarta.

links.text: -Ewokor, Chris (10 August 2021). "Anger as Nigerian diplomat manhandled in Indonesia". BBC News. Retrieved 11 August 2021.-

Data.event_text: Immigration officials gave clarification on the video, citing that the diplomat was being aggressive and had attacked officials prior to the video. The aftermath of the incident was later resolved in the Nigerian Embassy.

links.text: -Rahayu, Lisye Sri (10 August 2021). "Dubes RI Klarifikasi ke Kemlu Nigeria soal Diplomat Teriak 'I Can't Breathe'". Detik. Retrieved 11 August 2021.-

Data.event_text: 15 August  Government sent humanitarian mission to Afghanistan following Taliban's takeover of Kabul.

links.text: -Darmawan, Rakha Arlyanto (22 August 2021). "TNI AU Ungkap Kronologi Misi Evakuasi WNI dari Afganistan". Detik. Retrieved 22 August 2021.-

Data.event_text: Indonesian government successfully evacuated a total of 26 Indonesians and 2 Afghan nationals to Jakarta.

links.text: -Fazli, Achmad Zulfikar (21 August 2021). "Dievakuasi dari Afghanistan, 26 WNI Tiba di Indonesia". Medcom. Retrieved 22 August 2021.-

Data.event_text: Foreign Minister Retno Marsudi announces that the Indonesian diplomatic mission in Afghanistan has been moved to Islamabad, Pakistan.

links.text: -Suroyo, Gayatri (August 21, 2021). Mallard, William (ed.). "Indonesia moves Afghan diplomatic mission to Pakistan, evacuates dozens". Reuters. Archived from the original on 26 August 2021. Retrieved 22 August 2021.-

-Suroyo, Gayatri (August 21, 2021). Mallard, William (ed.). "Indonesia moves Afghan diplomatic mission to Pakistan, evacuates dozens". Reuters. Archived from the original on 26 August 2021. Retrieved 22 August 2021.-

Data.event_text: 23 August  Former Minister of Social Affairs Juliari Batubara, who was convicted for embezzlement of COVID-19 aids, was sentenced to 12 years in prison.

links.text: -Riana, Friski (23 August 2021). Budiman, Aditya (ed.). "Hakim Vonis Juliari Batubara 12 Tahun Penjara dan Denda Rp 500 Juta". Tempo. Retrieved 6 September 2021.-

Data.event_text: Protests held by Afghan refugees turned violent in Central Jakarta.

links.text: -"5 Fakta Ricuh Demo Pencari Suaka Afghanistan di Kantor UNHCR Jakarta". Detik. Retrieved 6 September 2021.-

Data.event_text: Government to extend PPKM until 30 August.

links.text: -Saptoyo, Rosy Dewi Arianti (24 August 2021). Nugroho, Rizal Setyo (ed.). "PPKM Diperpanjang hingga 30 Agustus, Ini Syarat Perjalanan Terbaru". Kompas. Retrieved 6 September 2021.-

Data.event_text: 30 August  PPKM to be extended until 6 September. Social restrictions were slightly eased following decreasing number of COVID-19 infections.

links.text: -Dzulfaroh, Ahmad Naufal (30 August 2021). Nugroho, Rizal Setyo (ed.). "PPKM Diperpanjang hingga 6 September 2021, Ini Penyesuaian Aturannya". Kompas. Retrieved 6 September 2021.-

Data.event_text: 2 September  Indonesia launched a probe following massive data breach of electronic Health Alert Card (eHAC) users.

links.text: -"Indonesia probes million data breach as potential leak of peoples personal record could have been stolen". The Star. Retrieved 6 September 2021.-

Data.event_text: Calls for greater personal data protection and regulation following leak of Joko Widodo's personal information on social media.

links.text: -Zamzami, Fitriyan (3 September 2021). "Data Jokowi 'Bocor', Regulasi Mendesak". Republika. Retrieved 6 September 2021.-

Data.event_text: Indonesian Broadcasting Commission was under fire after a Twitter thread of alleged sexual harassment and bullying on a male employee went viral. Police decided to investigate the case following public outcry.

links.text: -"Dugaan Pelecehan Seksual-Perundungan di KPI Bikin Polisi Turun Tangan". Detik. Retrieved 9 September 2021.-

Data.event_text: 4 September  Multiple Muslim organizations voiced their condemnations following attack on an Ahmadiyya mosque in Sintang Regency, West Kalimantan.

links.text: -"Suara-suara Ormas Islam Mengecam Perusakan Masjid Ahmadiyah". Detik. Retrieved 6 September 2021.-

Data.event_text: MV Henri, a fishing vessel carrying 32 crew members was caught on fire near Tanimbar Islands, Maluku. At least 2 people were killed and 18 people were missing.

links.text: -Alamsyah, Syahdan (9 September 2021). "Kronologi Kapal Terbakar-Hilangnya 18 Nelayan Sukabumi dan Cianjur di Maluku". Detik. Retrieved 9 September 2021.-

Data.event_text: Indonesia recorded a positivity rate of 4.57 percent, the lowest rate since the COVID-19 pandemic began in the country in March 2020.

links.text: -"Indonesia records its lowest rate of positive coronavirus tests". The Jakarta Post. Retrieved 9 September 2021.-

Data.event_text: PPKM to be extended until 13 September with further relaxations on social restrictions.

links.text: -Gunadha, Reza; Aranditio, Stephanus (6 September 2021). "BREAKING NEWS! PPKM Level 4 Pulau Jawa â Bali Diperpanjang sampai 13 September 2021". Suara. Retrieved 9 September 2021.-

Data.event_text: 7 September  More than 500,000 people signed a petition to bar Indonesian dangdut performer Saipul Jamil from appearing on TV following his release from prison. He had served 3 years in prison for sexual assault on a minor.

links.text: -"Saipul Jamil: Row over sex offender appearing on Indonesian TV". BBC News. 7 September 2021. Retrieved 9 September 2021.-

Data.event_text: 8 September  At least 49 inmates were killed and more than 70 others were injured after a massive fire broke out at a penitentiary in Tangerang, Banten.

links.text: -Budiman, Yuddy Cahya; Widianto, Stanley (8 September 2021). "Fire kills 41 in overcrowded Indonesia prison block". Reuters. Retrieved 9 September 2021.-

Data.event_text: 8-16 September  The Central Kalimantan floods affected 11 regencies and cities in Kalimantan province, resulting in a state of emergency and the deaths of 2 people.

links.text: -"Flood hits Central Kalimantan in Indonesia". www.xinhuanet.com. Retrieved 2024-08-24.-

Data.event_text: 11 September  Bombs used for blast fishing exploded in a residential area in Pasuruan Regency, East Java. A total of 2 people were killed 2 others were wounded by the explosion.

links.text: -Arifin, Muhajir (11 September 2021). "Ledakan Keras di Pasuruan yang Tewaskan 2 Orang Berasal dari Bondet". Detik. Retrieved 12 September 2021.-

Data.event_text: 15 September  A DHC-6-300 operated by Rimbun Air crashed onto a heavily forested area in Papua, killing all three crew members on board.

links.text: -Suwandi, Dhias (15 September 2021). Belarminus, Robertus (ed.). "Pesawat Rimbun Air Ditemukan dalam Kondisi Hancur, Polisi: Kecil Kemungkinan Kru Selamat". Kompas. Retrieved 19 September 2021.-

Data.event_text: 17 September  President Joko Widodo along with 6 other top officials were ruled against the Jakarta High Court for failing to ensure clean air in Jakarta, in what environmentalists called as a "landmark case".

links.text: -Llewellyn, Aisyah (17 September 2021). "Indonesians hail 'unexpected win' in landmark pollution case". Al Jazeera. Retrieved 23 September 2021.-

Data.event_text: 18 September  Leader of East Indonesia Mujahideen, Ali Kalora, was shot dead by authorities in the mountainous regions in Parigi Moutong Regency.

links.text: -Ramadhan, Ardito (18 September 2021). Rastika, Icha (ed.). "Sosok Ali Kalora, Pemimpin Kelompok Teroris Poso yang Dikabarkan Tewas". Kompas. Retrieved 19 September 2021.-

Data.event_text: 21 September  Search and rescue team ended their search operation for 25 missing crew members following a fire aboard the fishing vessel MV Henri.

links.text: -Leonard, Daniel (21 September 2021). Atmoko, Muhammad Hari (ed.). "Pencarian 25 ABK KM Hentri ditutup". Antara News. Retrieved 23 September 2021.-

Data.event_text: 24 September  Deputy Speaker of People's Representative Council Azis Syamsuddin was arrested by the Indonesian Corruption Eradication Commission.

links.text: -Hariyanto, Puguh (24 September 2021). "Azis Syamsuddin Ditangkap di Rumahnya". SindoNews. Retrieved 11 October 2021.-

Data.event_text: 2 October  President Joko Widodo opened the 20th PON (National Sports Week) in Jayapura, Papua.

links.text: -Assegaf, Fardah, ed. (2 October 2021). "PON XX opening ceremony in Papua starts". Antara News. Retrieved 11 October 2021.-

Data.event_text: 4 October  Violent clash ensued following the death of former regent of Yahukimo Regency, Abock Busup. The riot killed 6 while 41 people were injured. At least 52 rioters were arrested.

links.text: -Pebrianto, Fajar; Rahma, Andita (5 October 2021). Wibowo, Eko Ari (ed.). "Begini Kronologi Kerusuhan di Yahukimo". Tempo. Retrieved 11 October 2021.-

Data.event_text: Toxic gas inside a sewer in Tangerang killed 5 people.

links.text: -Kurniawan, Endra (8 October 2021). "FAKTA Gorong-gorong Maut di Tangerang, 5 Orang Tewas Keracunan Gas, Begini Kronologinya". Tribun News. Retrieved 11 October 2021.-

Data.event_text: World Anti Doping Agency (WADA) sanctioned Indonesia for the country's non-compliance with the anti-doping code. The flag of Indonesia will not be able to be hoisted during medal ceremony. Indonesia will also not be able to host regional, continental or international sports competition due to the sanction.

links.text: -Puspa, Farahdilla (8 October 2021). Bagaskara, Sem (ed.). "Dinilai Tak Patuh, Indonesia Dapat Sanksi dari Badan Antidoping Dunia". Kompas. Retrieved 5 November 2021.-

Data.event_text: Sudden flash flood struck a group of students who were exploring a river in Ciamis, West Java, drowning 11.

links.text: -Hermansyah, Dadang (15 October 2021). "Ini Identitas 11 Siswa Tewas Saat Susur Sungai di Ciamis". Detik. Retrieved 16 October 2021.-

Data.event_text: A shallow magnitude 5.1 earthquake struck the Indonesian island of Bali, killing 3 and injuring more than 70.

links.text: -Nugroho, Rizal Setyo (2021-10-15). "Gempa Bali M 4,8 Dirasakan hingga Lombok". KOMPAS.com (in Indonesian). Retrieved 2023-05-16.-

Data.event_text: 17 October  Indonesia won the 2020 Thomas Cup, the first title since 2002.

links.text: -Pratama, Mohammad Resha (17 October 2021). "Indonesia Juara Piala Thomas 2020, Penantian 19 Tahun Berakhir". Detik. Retrieved 5 November 2021.-

Data.event_text: 23 October  President Joko Widodo ordered total overhaul on the country's anti-doping agency LADI following sanction from WADA and outrage from Indonesians.

links.text: -Tambun, Lenny Trstia (23 October 2021). "President Orders Thorough Overhaul in Anti-Doping Agency". Jakarta Globe. Retrieved 5 November 2021.-

Data.event_text: 26 October  Two trains of Jakarta light rail transit collided in Cibubur, Jakarta during a test run. No one was killed in the incident however a conductor was wounded.

links.text: -Chaterine, Rahel Narda (25 October 2021). Prabowo, Dani (ed.). "5 Fakta Tabrakan LRT di Cibubur, Diduga Human Error hingga Dirut INKA Minta Maaf". Kompas. Retrieved 5 November 2021.-

Data.event_text: 4 November  At least 9 people were killed and 1 other was missing after flash flood swept the city of Batu, East Java.

links.text: -Mubyarsah, Latu Ratri (5 November 2021). "Banjir Bandang Batu, 9 Orang Tewas, 1 Masih Hilang". Jawa Pos. Retrieved 6 November 2021.-

Data.event_text: 6 November  Dean of Sriwijaya University's Social and Political Studies was accused of harassing students. The accused later threatened a Rp10 million lawsuit for defamation to the victim.

links.text: -Tanjung, Banda Haruddin (6 November 2021). "Dituding Cium Mahasiswi, Dekan Fisip Unri Ancam Lapor Balik dan Tuntut Ganti Rugi Rp10 Miliar". Okezone. Retrieved 28 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: 9 November  Islamic factions accused newly published Ministry of Education and Culture's Anti-Sexual Violence Bill as "legalizing premarital sex".

links.text: -Permana, Rakhmad Hidayatulloh (9 November 2021). "Tudingan Legalkan Zina Dibantah, Ini Pasal-pasal Kontroversial Permen PPKS". Detik. Retrieved 28 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: 11 November  Police arrested Tubagus Joddy, Vanessa Angel's personal driver, following the deadly crash in Jombang-Mojokerto toll road which killed the famed actress.

links.text: -Persada, Syailendra, ed. (11 November 2021). "Sopir Vanessa Angel Tersangka, Terancam Pidana 6 Tahun Penjara". Tempo. Retrieved 28 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: President Joko Widodo officially opened the Mandalika International Street Circuit.

links.text: -Santia, Tira (12 November 2021). "Sirkuit Mandalika Diresmikan Presiden, Jokowi Langsung Balapan". Liputan6. Retrieved 28 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: Indonesian Ulema Council declared cryptocurrency as haram.

links.text: -Rafie, Barratut Taqiyyah (12 November 2021). "Mata uang kripto dinyatakan haram, ini penjelasan MUI". Kontan. Retrieved 21 January 2022.-

Data.event_text: 24 November  Police arrested Sriwijaya University's Dean of Social and Political Studies for sexual harassment.

links.text: -Chandra, Riki (24 November 2021). "Jadi Tersangka Pelecehan Mahasiswi, Dekan FISIP UNRI Belum Juga Dinonaktifkan". Suara. Retrieved 28 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: 1 December  Rocky Gerung and three other opposition figures were officially reported to the police for hate speech.

links.text: -Yaningsi, Helmi (1 December 2021). "Hari Ini! Rocky Gerung Dilaporkan ke Bareskrim oleh Pergerakan Advokat Nusantara". MakassarTerkini.id. Retrieved 1 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: 2 December  China issued protest to the Indonesian government after Indonesian authorities deployed vessels for oil and gas exploration in Indonesia's Exclusive Economic Zone in Natuna.

links.text: -"Laporan China minta Indonesia hentikan pengeboran minyak di Laut Natuna: 'Indonesia tidak perlu takut' karena beroperasi di wilayah hak berdaulat". BBC News Indonesia. BBC. Retrieved 28 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: Sri Lelawangsa train crashes into an angkot at West Medan, killing 5 and injuring 4.

links.text: -"Terobos Palang, Angkot Disambar Kereta Api, 5 Penumpang Dikabarkan Tewas". medanpos (in Indonesian). Retrieved 2021-04-12.-

Data.event_text: Mount Semeru erupted in East Java, killing dozens of people.

links.text: -"Indonesia volcano: Volcano rescuers face ash as high as rooftops". BBC News. 2021-12-05. Retrieved 2021-12-05.-

Data.event_text: 8 December  President Joko Widodo visited Sintang Regency in West Kalimantan following massive flood that had been sweeping the area for weeks.

links.text: -"Warga Sintang: Kunjungan Jokowi Jadi Pengobat Duka Setelah Banjir". Detik. Retrieved 28 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: 11 December  Outrage following the discovery of a serial rapist inside an Islamic boarding school in Bandung.

links.text: -Karang, Ari Maulana; Permadi, Arie; Ramdhani, Dendi (11 December 2021). Ika, Aprilia; Ramadhan, Maulana (eds.). "Bejatnya Herry Wirawan, Guru Pesantren yang Perkosa 12 Santriwati hingga Melahirkan Anak". Kompas. Retrieved 28 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: 14 December - More than 800 houses were destroyed and another 1,200 were damaged following a major 7.3 earthquake off the coast of Flores, East Nusa Tenggara. At least one person was killed and dozens injured.

links.text: -Mappiwali, Hermawan (23 December 2021). "8 Hari Dirawat RS, 1 Warga Selayar Sulsel Korban Gempa M 7,4 Meninggal". Detik. Retrieved 21 January 2022.-

Data.event_text: 15 December  Authorities confirmed the first case of the highly transmissible COVID-19 Omicron variant.

links.text: -Nugraheny, Dian Erika (16 December 2021). Erdianto, Kristian (ed.). "6 Fakta Seputar Kasus Pertama Infeksi Varian Omicron di RSDC Wisma Atlet". Kompas. Retrieved 28 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: 16 December - At least 4 people were injured and dozens of homes were damaged following a shallow 5.1 earthquake in Jember, East Java.

links.text: -Albab, Mohamad Ulil (16 December 2021). Nashrillah, Faiz (ed.). "Update Gempa Jember, 4 Orang Luka-luka, 29 Rumah Rusak". IDN Times. Retrieved 21 January 2022.-

Data.event_text: 27 December  Three members of the Indonesian Armed Forces were arrested following the death of a couple in Nagreg. The bodies of both lovers had been discovered by authorities in Serayu River in Central Java.

links.text: -Darmawan, Reza Kurnia (27 December 2021). "Jadi Tersangka, 3 Anggota TNI Penabrak Sejoli di Nagreg Ditahan". Kompas. Retrieved 28 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: 28 December  Health ministry confirmed the first locally transmitted case of the Omicron variant in Indonesia.

links.text: -"Kronologi Pasien Transmisi Lokal Omicron Pertama di RI Terdeteksi". Detik. Retrieved 28 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: 30 December - At least 2 houses were destroyed following a deep 7.3 magnitude earthquake in Maluku.

links.text: -Patty, Rahmat Rahman; Bere, Sigiranus Marutho (30 December 2021). Arief, Teuku Muhammad Valdy; Darmawan, Reza Kurnia; Hartik, Andi (eds.). "Fakta Gempa M 7,3 di Maluku, 2 Rumah Dilaporkan Roboh, Getaran Dirasakan hingga NTT". Kompas. Retrieved 21 January 2022.-

Data.event_text: 31 December - Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources issued a ban on coal export due to fears of a supply crisis. The ban is set no6 take effect on 1 January and will stay for at least a month.

links.text: -Rahayu, Arfyana Citra (5 January 2022). Perwitasari, Anna Suci (ed.). "Soal Larang Ekspor Batubara, Pemerintah Pusat dan Pemda Beda Suara". Kontan. Retrieved 21 January 2022.-
